results.title: Les Batisseurs de Cathedrales
results.brief_description:
Episode 11 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Following the fall of the Carolingian Empire, Europe at the beginning of Xth century lives in a climate of constant insecurity. It is in this climate that great advances in architecture are made, in particular in vaulting techniques. Other topics include: the Crusades. See also: ‘Le temps de cathedrales’ (Series #S002025)

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: La guerre de cent ans = The hundred year war
results.brief_description:
Episode 13 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Hundred Years’ War was an intermittent struggle between England and France in the 14th-15th century. The main reasons for disputes included the question of the legitimate succession to the French crown. The struggle involved several generations of English and French claimants to the crown and actually occupied a period of more than 100 years. By convention it is said to have started in 1337 and ended in 1453, but there had been periodic fighting over the question of English fiefs in France going back to the 12th century. Historians have long considered the Hundred Years’ War a milestone in the development of national consciousness in western Europe. The English, after their many successes and frustrations, were finally cured of their taste for continental intervention, and the English monarchs turned increasingly to the problems of internal development. The hard-fought success of the house of Valois in securing the French crown helped insure that France would not become a realm in name only, partitioned among numerous independent princes. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Les Carolingiens
results.brief_description:
Episode 9 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Overview of the Carolingians’ rise and fall, from the crowning of Charlemagne in 814 to the partition of his Empire by his three sons in 843

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L'homme de Neandertal
results.brief_description:
Episode 2 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).This episode takes us among a tribe of hunters and gatherers to find out more about their tool making techniques. We also discover how their society is affected by the Ice Age.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Siecle D'or Espagnol
results.brief_description:
Episode 15 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Though the traditional beginning of the Reconquista goes back to 718, when the Christian Asturians opposed the Moors at the Battle of Covadonga, the impulse toward reconquest was not strong during the first three centuries of Muslim hegemony. It was in the 11th century, when Moorish unity broke down and the Christian kingdoms of northern Spain began to be affected by an aggressive, anti-Muslim, crusading spirit, that the movement began in earnest. A series of wars followed, and by the mid-13th century most of the peninsula had been subjected to Christian rule, though the continued existence of a Moorish enclave around Granada in southern Spain served to keep the spirit of the Reconquista alive until the end of the 15th century. Many historians believe that subsequent Spanish emphasis on religious uniformity, evidenced by the strong influence of the Inquisition and the expulsion of people of Moorish and Jewish descent, can be traced back to this crusading struggle of the Middle Ages. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica. Other topics include: The beginning of the slave trade, the Conquistadores and prominent artists of the period, such as El Greco and Cervantes.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: L'angleterre D'elizabeth = Elizabethan England
results.brief_description:
Episode 16 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Elizabeth I becomes Queen at 25. Her 39 articles lay the foundation for the Anglican church. Declared a heretic by the Pope, she also has to battle with Spain for naval supremacy. Other topics include: the beginning of circumnavigation, the voyages of Sr Francis Drake and the settlement of North America.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Pierre le Grand et son epoque = Pierre the Great and his times
results.brief_description:
Episode 19 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Peter the Great, czar of Russia (1672-1725) was one of this country’s greatest statesmen, organisers, and reformers. Major events of his reign are covered in this episode, including the war against Sweden, the construction of St Petersburg and Peter’s various attempts at modernising the country and opening it to Western ideas.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Pax Romana
results.brief_description:
Episode 7 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
In 52 BC, Julius Cesar defeats Vercingetorix and conquers Gaul. Soon the Pax Romana will expand to all of Europe and the British Isles. This episode presents an overview of Roman civilisation with a particular focus on civil and military engineering.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Once Upon a Time ...
results.brief_description:
Episode 26 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Man has always been bad at planning. This episode takes us forward in time to show us the potentially fatal consequence of our inability or illwill to care for the environement and consider ecologically sustainable responses to developement. Topics include: recycling, crisis for resources, nuclear destruction and space exploration.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].
